results.title: Not without sight
results.creator_credit: Arthur Zigouras, Joshua Aronson and American Foundation for the Blind
results.brief_description: Uses the example of four people with different kind of eye trouble in order to show the main courses of visual impairment and to show how these impairments affect sight.

results.title: Not just a number
results.creator_credit: Shalagh McCarthy, Rob Richardson and Amalgamated Metal Workers and Shipwrights Union
results.brief_description: A three part documentary examining industrial democracy in Australia: 1) Job redesign. Demonstrates how employees exercise decision-making, responsibility and initiative in their private lives and contracts with the usual workplace situation where most decisions are made by management. 2) Better managers. Shows a factory owned and operated by the workers providing a working example of successful worker participation and industrial democracy. 3) Is it a con? Examines unsuccessful industrial democracy initiatives where only the semblance of power has been transferred to the workers.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Shalagh McCarthy, Rob Richardson and Amalgamated Metal Workers and Shipwrights Union

results.title: Not enough
results.creator_credit: Wim Van Der Velde, Organisation for Economic Co-operation and Development and Ben Haanstra Film Productions
results.brief_description: About responsibility to developing countries. The apathy in rich countries is contrasted with the misery and toil of people in poor countries such as India who are attempting to develop their natural resources. Population growth is seen to be greater than increases in food production.

results.title: Not Crippled, Not Useless
results.brief_description: Michael Briffa is fourteen and will probably be confined to a wheelchair for the rest of his life. This program explores Michael’s determination and success in being allowed to enrol in an ordinary school. As well, Michael’s parents discuss their attitudes to special schools.

results.title: Norwegian fisheries
results.brief_description: Traces the development and organisation of the Norwegian fishing industry. Shows the variety of fishing methods, the handling and processing of the catch. A fisherman and his wife discuss life in the coastal village and the outlook for the future.

results.title: Norwegian contrasts
results.brief_description: Tourists come to admire the physical and cultural beauties of Norway, but there is more to the country than that…there has always been the sea. Norwegian fishermen are responsible for 5 percent of the global catch. The film goes on to cover the problems associated with agriculture, the drift to the cities, industrialisation and pollution.

results.title: Northern oasis
results.creator_credit: E.M. Jackson and Boort Progress Association
results.brief_description:
A silent film about life in the North-Western Victorian country town of Boort during the 1940s. Produced by and for the people of Boort and district.
The Loddon Weir is shown, as are: local livestock sales, dairy, poultry, pork and citrus farming, school children at the small local school and Australia Day celebrations with athletics, a fashion parade, tennis, lawn bowls and decorative boat river regatta. The film ends with the “Water - the life-blood of the North. The future progress and prosperity of this Northern-Oasis depend upon its assured supply.”

results.title: Northern New England, USA: an invitation
results.brief_description: Northern New England is a place where, each year nature becomes the artist. This does not only apply to autumn, when nature splashes the mountains with every colour of the rainbow, but to the rest of the seasons as well, making Northern New England an all year round vacation paradise.

results.title: North west link
results.brief_description: Made by Telecom and the Postmaster-Generals dept. the film shows the work of laying a 600-mile coaxial cable from Perth to Carnarvon, W.A. The pipe is a link in the national broad-band telecommunication network extending the range of subscriber trunk dialling and television relay facilities.
